name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Windmill Village Hotel Golf & Leisure Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing stay at this Hotel. The service we received was 1st class. All the staff were friendly & efficient. The two ladies on the front desk went out of their way to help us & couldn't do enough. Even booking restaurants & transport wasn't a problem & their recommendations really helped. To be honest we couldn't say a bad world about this hotel or its staff. We have stayed in the past & since then the hotel has made various changes, all of which has only improved the experience even more. We will definitely return & hope to bring friends.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you stay at The windmill Village you want for nothing. Our room was a real joy, we had a patio door which opened onto a paved area complete with table and chairs which overlooked the golf course and farmland beyond. From the moment we stepped into the hotel we were made to feel at home. The staff are masters of their craft but also treated us as long lost friends.without being intrusive. All the food we had was top notch, culminating with a breakfast which will long be remembered. All in all staying at the Windmill was a memorable experience. My wife and I both thougt it was money exceedingly well spent.
reviews.title: Enhance your break,stay here

reviews.text: brilliant stay food excellent,staff absolutely superb and very helpful.Especially Sophie and Katharine.
reviews.title: Most caring reception staff met on our travels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after getting married locally, and although the hotel didn't make any allowances for us, they were very friendly, as were the other guests, who kept coming up to congratulate us. The room itself was very clean, with a shiny bathroom! The bed was super comfy, and we loved the balcony out onto the golf course. We would stay here again!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: Me and 5/6 friends have been returning here for 5 years plus for weekend golf break. The staff are great in all areas from reception > golf shop > bar > restaurant. A bonus not always available but worth asking for, are twin rooms that have patio doors onto 1st fairway.
reviews.title: Great Golf, Friendly Hotel & Barstaff

reviews.text: We held our wedding here on the 02nd July and ever since our family and friend have raved about what an amazing venue it was and how spectacular the food was!
reviews.title: We had our wedding here..............it was amazing!!!

reviews.text: We had around 75 day guests and from the moment we arrived everyone was greeted with a warm welcome, from the bar staff to the management team there is such a consistent level of service provided.
reviews.title: Could do so much better

reviews.text: Our Guests sat down to a three course meal which was one of the highlights of the day, each course was served in a timely manner, was hot and the food was so fresh. Praise to the banqueting team for delivering such a great service. with regards to our evening food that was equally as good, it was a hog roast served with extras.
reviews.title: Interesting hotel and gold course

reviews.text: The Hotel itself is very modern with lots of nice areas to sit and have a drink, the windmill suite where we had our wedding is beautiful and overlooks the golf course. The bedrooms are great value for money, clean and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Excellent!!

reviews.text: The restaraunt is also beautiful and always serves amazing food. The sunday carvery is not one to miss!
reviews.title: Loved it so much, we have already booked again!!!!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in May for his cousin's wedding. The walls are very thin so you are able to here your neighbors. They charge too much for internet access. We were stunned by the fees. I'm used to free wireless in US hotels. The breakfast was very good but it was an extra fee. The wedding reception was a lot of fun though and the service was pretty good. I also indulged in a massage and facial while there which I recommend. It was perfect the day after the wedding reception. The beds were ok but the rooms were fairly small so I didn't think it was the best value.
reviews.title: Ok Stay but convenient for Wedding held here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married in this hotel just over 12 months ago and was extreamly happy about everything on the day so when it came to our anniversary we didnt think twice about booking it. We booked a superior room with Dinner bed and breakfast. Check in was great the girl was most helpful, we were told to book dinner as they only had a few times left 7.30, 7.45 and 8.40 so we went for 7.30pm. Our room I was disappointed as to me it was a nice double not a superior room like we booked. When we went to dinner thats when it fell apart! The restuarant only the times as they only set 6 tables (as it was a sunday I can understand why) but we were put in the corner and was forgot about. When we ordered the wine it came to the table and was plonked on the table and the waitress walked off so we had to open it ourselves and poured it. Our mains came out before they had removed our starters so had to go back to the kitchen. Although our food was extreamly beauitful for a hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Shame about service

reviews.text: When we asked for the bill again that got plonked on the table and we had to wave a waitress down to explain it as we were on dinner bed and breakfast no one told us what was included and what wasnt. She happily said only pay for your wine so we did. It was like they are only a couple concentrate on the bigger groups.
reviews.title: Maybe good for one night stay...anymore then look elsewhere!

reviews.text: When we went back to our room it was like sleeping in the corridor, it was so noisey we hardly slept. So come 7am we were up dressed and ready for breakfast, Breakfast was good service was OK.
reviews.title: Weekend golf break

reviews.text: I would still recommend this hotel although our last visit wasnt good we had the most amazing wedding and the food is outstanding.
reviews.title: Good hotel & facilities let down by it's poor customer service

reviews.text: I arrived around 6pm on a Sunday evening, checked in after a long drive. Receptionist could have been friendlier, a little functionary. The room was close to reception, and all facilities really. The leisure club was lovely, a friendly assistant as you signed in, and a great pool, which was busier than I expected on a Sunday evening. The Sauna was great, very spacious, clean and with twinkly lights. The changing rooms very smart, don't forget your pound for the locker.
reviews.title: Nice pool, room and conference suites

reviews.text: The room was a little warm but the windows did open a little but still a bit too warm for me in this odd October weather. But a nice size room, very clean, and the duty manager brought me more tea and fresh milk which was much appreciated. The Duty Manager was really helpful as although I did exactly what he did the TV would not work for me, but he came very quickly and sorted it.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.text: The Wi Fi connection was good and quick, the password collected from reception was in a tiny font?! I didn't dine in the Restaurant that night, but the options for room service looked great too as an alternative.
reviews.title: Excellent !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got my 7am alarm call at 7.20am, but was up anyway as I was a bit warm.
reviews.title: Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the Restaurant overlooking the golf course was good. A good selection of juices, and hot buffet. The scrambled eggs didn't look to great, but after moving them a bit they looked better than the fried egg option, but didn't taste too good, a bit rubbery and split. Everything else was nice.
reviews.title: Excellent two night break

aka: Best Western Plus Windmill Village Hotel Golf And Leisure Club
description: We have the most luxurious rooms available for weekend breaks and business stays in the Birmingham, Coventry, Solihull and the NEC area. Unlike most luxury hotels we also boast golf courses, a health club and a leisure club. You will find that unlike most hotels you will have the opportunity to relax, play sport and dine in fine style.
